content: FOUR! Michael Bracewell finishes things off in nice fashion! Jahandad Khan bangs this short and on middle. The Kiwi skipper stays back and pulls it over mid-wicket for a boundary. NEW ZEALAND WIN BY 5 WICKETS!
Back of a length and on off, Michael Bracewell dabs it towards point for one.

OUT! TAKEN! Shadab Khan makes up for his dropped catch in fine fashion! Haris Rauf takes pace off, hits the length hard and on middle. Daryl Mitchell backs away to push it but fails to keep it down. The ball flies wide of short covers where Shadab dives to his right and takes a fantastic catch. Rauf appreciates that effort and it is all smiles between the duo.
Daryl Mitchell c S Khan b H Rauf 14 (14b 1x4 0x6)
On a length and on off, Mitchell Hay guides it towards point for one.
Nasty blow! Haris Rauf bowls a sharp bouncer, on middle. Daryl Mitchell looks to pull it away but misses and takes a blow on the back of the helmet. A mandatory concussion check to follow now.

DROPPED! That sums up the day for Pakistan! A slower one, full and on middle, Mitchell Hay looks to loft it away but gets a leading edge. Shadab Khan at extra covers tries to settle under it, but is all over it and spills it in the end. The Kiwis are one big hit away now!
SIX! Only 7 needed now! Haris Rauf lands this short of a length and on middle. Mitchell Hay stands tall, uses the pace on the ball and pulls it over the deep square leg fence for a biggie.
Quicker, fullish and on leg, Mitchell Hay nudges it through square leg. New Zealand need 13 runs in 18 balls.
Another short delivery, on middle, Daryl Mitchell pulls it to deep mid-wicket for one.
A half-tracker, on middle, Mitchell Hay pulls it deep mid-wicket for a run.
Short again and on off, Daryl Mitchell swats it to long off for one.
FOUR! Put away! Shadab Khan drags his length back and down the leg side. Daryl Mitchell gets into position quickly and helps it on its way to the fine leg fence for a boundary.
Flatter, short but well outside off, Daryl Mitchell fails to reach it. Wided.
Floated, short and on off, Mitchell Hay punches it through covers for a single.

Buzzers! Back of a length and on off, Daryl Mitchell slices it towards third man for a run. Mitchell Hay wants the second but is sent back. The fielder throws it to the keeper's end where Mohammad Haris collects and has a shy at the stumps but misses. That allows the batter to steal another run.
Pitched up and on off, Mitchell Hay drives it to mid off for one.
A sharp bouncer, on middle, Daryl Mitchell gets hurried and mistimes his pull to deep mid-wikcet for a run.
A full toss, on off, Mitchell Hay drills it towards covers for a single.
Short of a length and around leg, Mitchell Hay looks to hook it away but gets it through a bit early as the ball brushes against his shirt behind.
Back of a length and on off, Mitchell Hay punches it to covers.
Flighted, full and on middle, Mitchell Hay moves across and scoops it towards short fine for one.
Darts one full and outside off, Mitchell Hay bunts it out.
Quicker, full and on leg, Daryl Mitchell paddles it to short fine for one.
Shortish and on middle, Mitchell Hay works it through mid-wicket for another run.
Flatter, short and on off, Daryl Mitchell lobs it over covers for a run.
Short and on middle, Mitchell Hay punches it to long on for a single.
On a length and on off, Daryl Mitchell pushes it towards covers. New Zealand need 33 runs in 36 balls.
Overpitched and on middle, Mitchell Hay drills it wide of mid on for one.
FOUR! Easy pickings! Haris Rauf goes full but sliding down the leg side, Mitchell Hay glances it away to the fine leg fence for a boundary. 100 up for New Zealand!
Pitched up but down the leg side, Mitchell Hay misses his flick. Wided.

OUT! TAKEN SUPERBLY IN THE DEEP! Haris Rauf gets a wicket now! He bangs this one into the pitch and on middle. James Neesham connects with his pull well but hits it a bit flat towards deep square leg. Abdul Samad runs to his left and pouches it brilliantly with a dive. Is this the opening Pakistan were looking for?
James Neesham c A Samad b H Rauf 5 (4b 1x4 0x6)
FOUR! Lovely shot! Fuller one and around off. James Neesham opens the face of his bat and slices it over point for a boundary.
Back of a length and outside off, James Neesham slashes at it but misses.
Flighted, full and on off, Daryl Mitchell pushes it to short covers.
Fires one full but down the leg side, Daryl Mitchell tries to swipe it away but misses. Wided.
Short and around off, James Neesham punches it through covers for one.

OUT! TAKEN! Khushdil Shah strikes! One brings two for Pakistan! This is a bit slower through the air, short and on middle. Mark Chapman rocks back to pull it away but fails to get the timing right on this one. The ball flies straight towards deep square leg where Jahandad Khan takes it nicely with a reverse cup. The Kiwis are three down now!
Mark Chapman c J Khan b K Shah 1 (6b 0x4 0x6)
Short again and on leg, Daryl Mitchell paddles it to short fine. Shaheen Afridi fumbles but the batters take only one.
Flatter, short and outside off, Mark Chapman cuts it through point for a run.
Floated, full and on off, Daryl Mitchell drives it to long off for a single.
On a length and on middle, Daryl Mitchell clips it through square leg for one. 19 runs and a wicket off the over!

OUT! LBW! Jahandad Khan has the last laugh, but the damage is already done here! He goes fuller and on middle, angling in. Finn Allen steps across to slog it over mid-wicket but misses and gets hit on the pads. There is a big appeal for LBW, and this time the finger goes up. However, Allen takes the review here. UltraEdge confirms no bat involved and Ball Tracking comes up with two reds and wickets is umpire's call. The on-field call remains but the Kiwis do not lose the review.  Allen goes for a blazing 38 off 16, and New Zealand are 87/2.
Finn Allen lbw J Khan 38 (16b 1x4 5x6)

SIX! There she goes again! Jahandad Khan bangs this one short, slower too, but this sits up nicely for the batter. Finn Allen reads it early, waits for it and pummels it over the deep square leg fence for a 103 METRE SIX!
SIX! Going, going, gone! Pulls his length back slightly, on off. Finn Allen picks up the length early and uses his quick hands to launch it high and handsomely over the long on fence for a biggie.
FOUR! Gets it away! Jahandad Khan goes a bit too full and outside off. Finn Allen opens the face of his bat and lifts it beautifully over covers for a boundary.
Fuller and around off, Finn Allen lofts it over extra covers for a brace.

Goes fuller and on middle and leg, Mark Chapman tries to tuck it to the leg side but gets beaten by the pace and the ball hits him on the pads. There is another big shout for LBW, but turned down again.
A full toss, on middle, Finn Allen drills it to long on for a single.
On a length and on middle, holds its line, Finn Allen looks to flick but gets a leading edge in front of covers.
Fine bowling! Haris Rauf goes fuller and around off, shapes away. Finn Allen gets drawn into his drive as the ball zips past the outside edge.
Good length and on leg, Mark Chapman fails to work it away as the ball goes off his pads towards point. Another leg bye.

Fuller in length and on leg, shaping in, Finn Allen looks to flick it away but misses and gets hit on the pads. The ball rolls towards point and the batters take a leg bye. There is also a shout for LBW, but turned down.
Pitched up and on off, Mark Chapman pushes it towards covers.
BEAUTY! Back of a length and in that channel outside off, shaping away, Mark Chapman looks to play at it but gets beaten on the outside edge.

OUT! TAKEN! Mohammad Ali gets his first T20I wicket! Some relief for Pakistan! This is a slower one again, hard length and on middle. Tim Seifert backs away and looks to heave it away but goes through it a bit early. The ball hits him high on the bat and loops towards mid on where Shaheen Afridi takes a good catch. Seifert walks back after a fiery 45 off just 22!
Tim Seifert c S Afridi b M Ali 45 (22b 3x4 5x6)
FOUR! Pitched up and just around off, Tim Seifert gets right underneath it and lofts it over mid off for a boundary.
Mohammad Ali loses his grip again and this time serves this full, but outside the pitch. Tim Seifert lets it go. It is called a No ball. Free Hit coming up...
Tries the slower short one again, but bowls it well outside off. Almost out of the pitch. Tim Seifert still tries to cut but misses.

FOUR! Streaky but they all count! A slower one, back of a length and outside off. Tim Seifert throws his bat at it but gets an outside edge wide of short third. Haris Rauf puts in a tame dive to his left and lets it through for a boundary.

SIX! Up, up and away! Mohammad Ali lands this one short of a length and just around off. Tim Seifert gets on top of the bounce and dispatches it powerfully over the long on fence for a biggie. This has gone out of the ground and we will be needing another ball. We are being treated to some amazing six-hitting here!
Another short delivery, on middle, Tim Seifert pulls it away to deep square leg for on. 50 up for the Kiwis!
Quicker, short and outside off, Tim Seifert cuts it to point.
Short again and on off, Tim Seifert punches it to extra covers.
FOUR! First boundary of the game! Khushdil Shah drags his length back and around middle. Tim Seifert rocks back and heaves it away to the deep mid-wicket fence for a boundary.
Floated, full and on leg, Tim Seifert looks for the switch hit but misses.
Flatter, short and on middle, Finn Allen swats it to long on for a single.
SIX MORE! That has gone miles! Shaheen Afridi goes short again and around middle. Tim Seifert picks up the length early and hammers it way over the deep square leg fence for another biggie.
SIX! SMOKED! Back to usual business! Shaheen Afridi bangs this one into the pitch and around middle. Tim Seifert stands tall and whacks it over the deep mid-wicket fence for a biggie.
Overpitched and outside off, Tim Seifert squeezes it wide of point. The fielder dives to his left and gets a hand on that to make a half stop. Two runs taken.
Back of a length and on off, Tim Seifert stabs it down the pitch.
SIX! Incredible hitting! This is on a hard length and outside off. Tim Seifert this time reaches out for it and carves it over extra covers for another biggie.

SIX! New Zealand are only dealing with sixes here! Shaheen Afridi goes fuller and on off. Tim Seifert clears his front leg away, presents the full face of the bat and tonks it over the long off fence for half a dozen more.

SIX! Number three of the over! Mohammad Ali bangs this one into the pitch, on middle, angling in. Finn Allen stays back and looks to hook it away, Gets a bit of a top edge that flies well over fine leg for another biggie. 18 runs off the over!
Hard length and on off, Finn Allen pats it towards covers.
Back of a length and on off, Finn Allen steers it to short third.
SIX! BOOM! Finn Allen goes big again! Fuller one and just around off. Allen skips down the track, reaches out a bit and smacks it over extra covers for another flat six.
BEAUTY! Good-length delivery, on off, threatens to shape in but holds its line with extra bounce. Finn Allen has a poke at it but gets beaten on the outside edge.

SIX! BANG! The Kiwis get underway in the chase! Mohammad Ali begins with a short-of-a-length delivery, outside off. Finn Allen gets the chance to free his arms and crunches it over point. The ball lands directly on the cushions for a biggie.
MAIDEN OVER! Shaheen Afridi hits the length hard and around off, angling away, Tim Seifert looks for the scoop but misses.
Good length and around leg, shaping in, Tim Seifert tries to help it on its way but misses and gets hit on the body again.
A full toss, on middle, Tim Seifert looks to hit it a bit too hard, loses his shape and swipes it to mid-wicket. Four dots in a row now!

A big appeal for caught behind, but turned down! Shaheen Afridi lands this on a hard length and on middle and off, nips back in again. Tim Seifert gets stuck in his crease and looks to work it away but misses. The ball goes off the pads behind where Mohammad Haris pouches it. Pakistan takes the review here but UltraEdge shows no spike. For formality, Ball Tracking also comes up but it shows pitching is outside leg. Pakistan lose a review in the first over!

Ouch! Short of a length and on middle, nips back in sharply. Tim Seifert looks to defend but gets cramped up a bit and the ball hits him hard on the ribs. He is down on his haunches and looking in some pain here.
Shaheen Afridi starts with a back-of-a-length delivery, on off, Tim Seifert hops up and dabs it to point.

OUT! RUN OUT! James Neesham bowls another wide yorker, on off, Shaheen Afridi jams it out towards sweeper covers and turns around for the second. Michael Bracewell is quick to pick up the ball and throw it at the bowler's end on the bounce. James Neesham collects it and breaks the stumps with Rauf well short of his crease. Pakistan finishes on 135/9!
Haris Rauf run out (Michael Bracewell / James Neesham) 1 (1b 0x4 0x6)
A low full toss, outside off, Shaheen Afridi drills it towards deep point for a couple of runs. Can Afridi finish the innings on a high?
Gets the wide yorker right this time, outside off, angling away, Shaheen Afridi fails to dig it out.

SIX! BANG! He connects this time alright! Pitched up and around off again, in the slot this tie. Shaheen Afridi clears his front leg away and smokes it over the deep mid-wicket fence for a biggie. That ball seems to have been lost. Oh..wait! Someone in the crowd has found it and throws it over on the field. We are good to go!
A slower one, full again and around off, Shaheen Afridi goes through his slog sweep early and misses again.
Goes fuller again but a bit too outside off, angling further away, Shaheen Afridi fails to reach out for it. Wided.
A dot to start the last over! Fuller one and on off, angling away, Shaheen Afridi looks to slog it across the line but misses.
Full and on the pads, Shaheen Afridi clips it through square leg for one and keeps the strike.
FOUR! TWO IN TWO! Pitched up and on middle, angling in. Shaheen Afridi clears his front leg away and heaves it between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket for another boundary.
FOUR! Smacked away! Zakary Foulkes goes a bit fuller this time, on middle and off. Shaheen Afridi backs away and smashes it through extra covers for a boundary.
Swing and a miss! Zakary Foulkes bangs this one hard into the pitch, outside off. Shaheen Afridi swings wildly across the line but only connects with thin air.
Back of a length and on middle, angling in, Haris Rauf gets cramped up and tucks it to the leg side for a run.
Short of a length and outside off, Shaheen Afridi throws his bat at it and slices it on the bounce to third man for a single.

OUT! TAKEN! James Neesham gets two wickets in the over! Good-length delivery on off. Abdul Samad looks to clear the infield, but it comes high off the bat and lobs up toward the mid-off region. Daryl Mitchell there, takes a simple catch. Pakistan are eight down now.
Abdul Samad c D Mitchell b J Neesham 11 (7b 0x4 1x6)
Hard-length delivery outside off. Shaheen Afridi slaps this to deep cover for a single.
Pace-off delivery, on a length, just outside off. Shaheen Afridi swings and misses.
Back of a length delivery, around off. Shaheen Afridi gets on top of the bounce and steers it to deep backward point for a brace.

OUT! TAKEN! James Neesham gets among the wickets! Slower ball on a length, around off. Jahandad Khan clears the front leg and looks to swing hard at it. It comes off the cue end and slices it toward the extra cover region. Zakary Foulkes runs around and takes a good catch. Pakistan are crumbling now.
Jahandad Khan c Z Foulkes b J Neesham 0 (2b 0x4 0x6)
On a length, around off. Abdul Samad taps into the off-side for a single.
Good length delivery at the stumps. Jahandad Khan defends from the crease.

OUT! CAUGHT! Another one bites the dust! Back-of-a-length delivery, into the pitch. Shadab Khan looks to clear the ropes but it comes off the cue end of the blade. Gets the height but not the distance and is taken near the long-on boundary by Daryl Mitchell. A handy knock from Shadab Khan comes to an end. Pakistan slides further.
Shadab Khan c D Mitchell b J Duffy 26 (14b 2x4 2x6)
LEG BYE! Pace-off, back of a length, around the right shoulder. Abdul Samad is early into the pull shot, comes off the body and lobs toward the gully region for a leg bye.
Back of a length outside off. Shadab Khan cuts it uppishly to deep backward point for one.

FOUR! Streaky but Shadab Khan will take it! Hard-length delivery, angled into the middle. Shadab Khan looks to swing it across the line but gets the outside edge that flies past the keeper and runs down to deep third for four runs.
WIDE! Slower bumper, wide outside off. Shadab Khan thinks about slapping it but lets it go at the last moment. Wide signaled by the umpire.
SIX! CRUNCHED! Pitched full, outside off. Shadab Khan picks it early and thrashes it over the extra cover fence for a flat six.
Tossed up on off. Abdul Samad slog-sweeps it toward deep square leg for a couple.
SIX! UP AND OVER! Full and wide outside off. Abdul Samad slices it high over cover where he times it well enough for it to clear the rope for six.

Low full toss on off. Shadab Khan clips it toward deep mid-wicket and calls for the second. James Neesham in the deep, collects it quickly and throws it at the bowler's end. Shadab Khan had left his crease for the second but puts the dive and gets back in time.
Tosses it on a length, turning into the middle and leg. Shadab Khan looks to heave but it comes off the pad and rolls to the left of the keeper.
FOUR! TOP SHOT! Tad short, on off. Shadab Khan makes room and smashes it through covers for a cracking boundary.
Flatter and quicker at the stumps. Abdul Samad gets some bat on it and works it through backward square leg for one.
Back of a length, around off. Shadab Khan looks to pull but it comes off the cue end, rolls to the keeper.
SIX! SMOKED! Slower ball on the full, around off. Shadab Khan gets low, picks it early, and deposits it over deep square leg for a maximum.
Back of a length, outside off. Shadab Khan charges down the pitch, swings, and misses.
Fuller than a good length, on the middle and leg. Abdul Samad turns it off the inner half through mid-wicket for one.

HOLES OUT! BEN SEARS GETS THE PAKISTAN SKIPPER! Short of a length delivery, around off. Salman Agha looks to muscle the pull but fails to get the desired connection. The ball goes toward the deep square leg region. Mark Chapman moves to his left and takes a sharp catch. Pakistan have lost half of their side now.
Salman Agha (c) c M Chapman b B Sears 46 (28b 4x4 3x6)
Short of a length, rising delivery, around off. Salman Agha looks to cut but misses.
Full and quick, just outside off. Bunted past the bowler for a single.
Wrong'un, on off. Salman Agha nudges it through mid-wicket for a couple.
FOUR! PUNISHED! Short and wide outside off. Salman Agha plays it away from the body and cuts it toward deep backward point for an easy boundary.
SIX! WHACKED! Tad short, on the middle. Salman Agha advances and hammers it over the deep mid-wicket boundary. Sails comfortably over the ropes for a biggie.
Drifted on the pad. Shadab Khan half pulls it to long-leg for one.
Tossed up wrong'un, on the middle and leg. Shadab Khan comes forward and defends it.
On a length, outside off. Salman Agha flays and misses.
Back of a length, rising delivery, around off. Salman Agha plays and misses at it.
SIX! WHIPPED! Pace-off delivery, on a length, outside off. Salman Agha drags it from outside and smokes it high over deep square leg for half a dozen.
Good length ball, at the stumps. Shadab Khan tucks it toward mid-wicket for one.
On a length, wide outside off. Shadab Khan cuts it through covers for a couple.
Short of a good length, just outside off. Salman Agha runs it down to the right of the keeper for one.

OUT! TAKEN! Ish Sodhi gets his second! Sodhi bowls a fullish googly, just outside off. Khushdil Shah looks to play across the line but looks to have missed. The keeper, Mitchell Hay looks confident of the edge and appeals but the umpire is unmoved. Michael Bracewell has a word with the bowler and the keeper and takes the review. The replays show a faint spike and the decision is overturned. Pakistan lose their fourth and are in some trouble now.
Khushdil Shah c M Hay b I Sodhi 2 (2b 0x4 0x6)
Leg break, on the middle and leg stump line. Khushdil Shah nudges it through mid-wicket for a couple to get off the mark.

OUT! CAUGHT! Soft dismissal for Irfan Khan. Ish Sodhi bowls a half-tracker, just outside off. Irfan Khan rocks back and looks to pull it hard over the leg side. Ends up getting the outside edge that flies toward short third. Ben Sears there, takes a simple catch and Pakistan are three down now.
Irfan Khan c B Sears b I Sodhi 11 (9b 1x4 1x6)
LEG BYE! Tossed up googly, on off. Salman Agha comes forward for the defence but the ball comes off the pad and rolls to short third for a leg bye. Half an appeal but the umpire was unmoved.
Flatter on off. Salman Agha shimmies down and blocks it onto the pitch.
Tad short, on off. Irfan Khan nudges it through square leg for one.

Short of a length, angled into the off-stump line. Salman Agha moves across for the pull but gets the top edge onto the helmet. The ball rolls to backward point. The physio comes for a mandatory concussion check. Salman Agha looks fine to carry on.
In the air but safe! Short ball, around the left shoulder. Salman Agha shuffles across for the pull but gets the top edge that flies down to fine leg region for a couple of streaky runs.
FOUR! PUT AWAY! On a length, wide outside off. Salman Agha cuts it over the backward point region and collects another boundary.
SIX! ALL THE WAY! Slower ball on the full, outside off. Salman Agha moves across and goes through with the shot. Lofts it over the wide long-off fence for a biggie.
Back of a length, around off. Salman Agha swings and misses.
Goes short, just outside off. Salman Agha goes for the pull but fails to connect.

FOUR! SMACKED! Short ball, angled into the middle and leg stump line. Irfan Khan backs away and swats it hard through mid-wicket. The ball has enough legs to beat the fielder and get to the ropes for four runs.
Pitched full, at the stumps. Irfan Khan plays a short-arm jab and flicks it just in front of the short mid-wicket fielder.
Short of a length, on the middle and leg. Salman Agha pulls this to deep square leg for one.
Foulkes goes full and just past the leg stump. Salman Agha backs away from the flick but the ball goes between his legs and through to the keeper.
Short of a length, angled down the leg. Salman Agha pulls it toward long-leg region for a couple.
FOUR! CRUNCHED! Back of a length delivery, wide outside off. Salman Agha accepts the width and cuts it over the point fielder for a cracking boundary.
SIX! BOOM! Good length delivery, on the middle and leg stump line. Irfan Khan shimmies down the pitch and lofts it cleanly over the wide long-on fence for half a dozen. That was a classy hit.

Back of a length again, just outside off. Irfan Khan advances for the swat but it comes off the cue end and lands just in front of the short cover fielder. Daryl Mitchell there, has a shy at the bowler's end but Salman Agha gets back in the crease.
Back of a length delivery, outside off. Irfan Khan flays and misses at it.
Banged in short, around off. Irfan Khan thinks about the pull but sways out of the line and lets it go.
Short of a length, on the off-stump line. Irfan Khan gets behind the line and defends.

OUT! TAKEN! BEN SEARS STRIKES STRAIGHT AWAY! Short and wide outside off. Sears gets a steep bounce as Haris flays it high in the air to the deep third region. Jacob Duffy sets himself under it and takes a comfortable catch just inside the rope. Both the openers are gone now for Pakistan.
Mohammad Haris (wk) c J Duffy b B Sears 11 (10b 2x4 0x6)
LEG BYE! Hard-length delivery, angled into the middle. Mohammad Haris swings across the line and it comes off the thigh pad, rolls to deep third for a leg bye.
Low full toss on off. Salman Agha looks to drive but it comes off the inner half, past the bowler, and toward mid-on for one.
Back of a length, angled into the middle. Salman Agha blocks from the crease.
FOUR! OVER THE TOP! Good length delivery on the middle and leg stump line. Salman Agha shimmies down the pitch, makes room, and lifts it inside out over extra cover for a majestic boundary.
On a length, on off. Mohammad Haris taps into the off-side and takes a quick single.
Pitched full, just outside off. Mohammad Haris charges down for the drive but fails to make the contact. Misses the off-stump by a whisker.

In the air but lands safe! Good length delivery, just outside off. Mohammad Haris gets across to play the scoop but it comes off the inner half, gets the edge onto the pad, and lobs up to the left of the keeper. The batters cross for a risky single.
On a length, around off. Mohammad Haris swings and misses.
FOUR MORE! NICELY DONE! Short of a length, outside off. Mohammad Haris hangs back and guides it over the keeper, toward the deep third region for a clever boundary.
FOUR! MUSCLED! Fuller than a length, angled into the middle. Mohammad Haris swings hard and hoicks it through the mid-wicket region for a boundary.
Lands it on a length, around off. Salman Agha runs it down to deep third for a single.
On a length, wide outside off. Salman Agha shuffles across and cuts this to backward point.
Fuller than a length nipping away, around off. Mohammad Haris flays and misses at this one. A tidy start from Jacob Duffy.
Good length delivery, just outside off. Dabbed down to deep third for a single.

OUT! CAUGHT! Jacob Duffy draws first blood. Lands it on a length, on off. Hasan Nawaz looks to heave it across the line but it comes off the cue end of the blade and flies off the edge toward the deep point region. Mark Chapman runs back, keeps his eye on the ball, and completes a fine catch. Hasan Nawaz trudges off for a duck twice in a row now. Pakistan are rocked early.
Hasan Nawaz c M Chapman b J Duffy 0 (3b 0x4 0x6)
Short of a good length, on the middle and leg. Hasan Nawaz gets behind the line and defends from the crease.
Good-length delivery, attacking the stumps. Hasan Nawaz offers full face of the bat and blocks it forward.
Pakistan are away! Pitched full and angled into the middle and leg stump line. Mohammad Haris clips it through mid-wicket for a single.
